roleset.name: less dense, in comparison to some standard

example.name: frequent usage
example.text: CT showed three small hypodensities in the liver .
example.amr: (s2 / show-01 :ARG0 (c / ct-01) :ARG1 (t / thing :quant 3 :ARG1-of (h / hypodense-01) :ARG1-of (s / small-01) :location (a / anatomical-site :name (n / name :op1 "liver"))))

example.name: predicated
example.text: Affected areas appear enlarged and hypodense on CT .
example.amr: (a / appear-02 :ARG1 (a2 / and :op1 (e / enlarge-01 :ARG1 (a3 / area :pl + :ARG1-of (a4 / affect-01))) :op2 (h / hypodense-01 :ARG1 a3)) :instrument (c / ct-01))

roleset.note: NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. No evidence yet for needing an additional argument for the reference entity (the thing ARG1 is less dense than); this appears, if at all, as a verbal argument (internet example: "hypodense compared to surrounding liver").
